Package camzup.core

Class Quaternion

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Quaternion
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Quaternion>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
A four-dimensional complex number. The x, y and z components are coefficients of the imaginary i, j and k. Discovered by William R. Hamilton with the formula i2 = j2 = k2 = ijk = -1.0 . Quaternions with a magnitude of 1.0 are commonly used to rotate 3D objects from one orientation to another over minimal distance without suffering gimbal lock.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Quaternion.AbstrComparator
    An abstract class that may serve as an umbrella for any custom comparators of Quaternions.
    static class  Quaternion.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of quaternion easing functions.
    static class  Quaternion.IteratorWFirst
    An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static class  Quaternion.IteratorWLast
    An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static class  Quaternion.Lerp
    A functional class to ease between two quaternions by linear interpolation (lerp).
    static class  Quaternion.QIterator
    An iterator, which allows a quaternion's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static class  Quaternion.Slerp
    A functional class to ease between two quaternions by spherical linear interpolation (slerp).

    static float dot​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b)
    Finds the dot product of two quaternions by summing the products of their corresponding components.

    a · b := areal breal + aimag · bimag

    The dot product of a quaternion with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.

    static Quaternion identity​(Quaternion target)

    static Quaternion inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
    Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the conjugate divided by the magnitude squared.

    a-1 := a* / |a|2

    If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
    static Quaternion inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target, Quaternion conjugate)
    Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the its conjugate divided by its magnitude squared.

    a-1 := a* / |a|2

    If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
    static Vec3 invMulVector​(Quaternion q, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
    Multiplies a vector by a quaternion's inverse, allowing a prior rotation to be undone.

      Attempts to construct a quaternion from Strings using Float.parseFloat(String) . If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero.

      real - the w string
      xImag - the x string
      yImag - the y string
      zImag - the z string

      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output quaternion
      sum - the sum
      Returns:
      the normalized sum
      See Also:
      add(Quaternion, Quaternion, Quaternion), normalize(Quaternion, Quaternion)

    • all

      public static boolean all​(Quaternion q)
      Tests to see if all the quaternion's components are non-zero.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      Vec3.all(Vec3)

      Tests to see if any of the quaternion's components are non-zero.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      Vec3.any(Vec3)

      the evaluation

    • conj

      public static Quaternion conj​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
      Returns the conjugate of the quaternion, where the imaginary component is negated.

      a* = { areal, -aimag }
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the conjugate
      See Also:
      Vec3.negate(Vec3, Vec3)

      public static Quaternion div​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b, Quaternion target)

    • dot

      public static float dot​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b)
      Finds the dot product of two quaternions by summing the products of their corresponding components.

      a · b := areal breal + aimag · bimag

      The dot product of a quaternion with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      Returns:
      the dot product
      See Also:
      Vec3.dot(Vec3, Vec3)

    • fromAngle

      public static Quaternion fromAngle​(float radians, Quaternion target)
      Sets a quaternion from an angle. The axis is assumed to be (0.0, 0.0, 1.0) . Sets the real component of the quaternion to cosine of the angle; the imaginary z component is set to the sine. Useful when working in 2.5D, where a two-dimensional angle may need to be transferred to a three-dimensional transform.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      Math.cos(double), Math.sin(double)

    • fromAxes

      public static Quaternion fromAxes​(float xRight, float yForward, float zUp, float zForward, float yUp, float xUp, float zRight, float yRight, float xForward, Quaternion target)
      Creates a quaternion from three axes - either separate vectors or the columns of a matrix. This is an internal helper function which uses only the relevant information to create a quaternion.
      Parameters:
      xRight - m00 : right x
      yForward - m11 : forward y
      zUp - m22 : up z
      zForward - m21 : forward z
      yUp - m12 : up y
      xUp - m02 : up x
      zRight - m20 : right z
      yRight - m10 : right y
      xForward - m01 : forward x
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      Math.copySign(float, float), Math.sqrt(double)

    • fromAxes

      public static Quaternion fromAxes​(Mat4 m, Quaternion target)
      Creates a quaternion from the axes of a matrix, which is assumed to represent a rotation only (i.e., does not include translation or scale).
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Quaternion)

    • fromAxes

      public static Quaternion fromAxes​(Vec2 right, Vec2 forward, Quaternion target)
      Creates a quaternion from three axes. The axes should already be normalized; in other words, they should match a pure rotation matrix.
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Quaternion)

      public static Quaternion fromAxes​(Vec3 right, Vec3 forward, Vec3 up, Quaternion target)

    • fromDir

      public static Quaternion fromDir​(Vec3 dir, Handedness handedness, Quaternion target)
      Creates a quaternion from a direction given a handedness. Normalizes the input direction. Also known as a 'lookAt' or 'toTracking' function.
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      Utils.invSqrtUnchecked(float), Utils.invHypot(float, float, float), fromAxes(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, Quaternion)

    • fromDir

      public static Quaternion fromDir​(Vec3 dir, Handedness handedness, Quaternion target, Vec3 right, Vec3 forward, Vec3 up)
      Creates a quaternion from a direction. Switches reference up if forward and reference up are parallel. Emits the right, forward and up axes as a byproduct of the function's calculations.
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output quaternion
      right - the output right axis
      forward - the output forward axis
      up - the output up axis
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      Vec3.none(Vec3), Vec3.right(Vec3), Vec3.forward(Vec3), Vec3.up(Vec3), Vec3.normalize(Vec3, Vec3), Vec3.crossNorm(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3), fromAxes(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3, Quaternion)

    • fromTo

      public static Quaternion fromTo​(Vec3 origin, Vec3 dest, Quaternion target)
      Creates a quaternion with reference to two vectors. This function creates normalized copies of the vectors.

      fromTo ( a, b ) := { a · b, a x b }

      The real component is the dot product of the vectors; the imaginary component is their cross product.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin vector
      dest - the destination vector
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the quaternion
      See Also:
      Utils.approx(float, float), Math.sqrt(double)

      Gets the string representation of the default Quaternion easing function.
      Returns:
      the string

    • getForward

      public static Vec3 getForward​(Quaternion q, Vec3 target)
      Gets the forward axis of the rotation. Equivalent to multiplying (0.0, 1.0, 0.0) by the quaternion. If all three axes need to be retrieved, use toAxes(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3) .
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the forward axis

    • getRight

      public static Vec3 getRight​(Quaternion q, Vec3 target)
      Gets the right axis of the rotation. Equivalent to multiplying (1.0, 0.0, 0.0) by the quaternion. If all three axes need to be retrieved, use toAxes(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3) .
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the right axis

    • getUp

      public static Vec3 getUp​(Quaternion q, Vec3 target)
      Gets the up axis of the rotation. Equivalent to multiplying (0.0, 0.0, 1.0) by the quaternion. If all three axes need to be retrieved, use toAxes(Quaternion, Vec3, Vec3, Vec3) .
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the up axis

    • identity

      public static Quaternion identity​(Quaternion target)
      Sets the target to the identity quaternion, ( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ).
      Parameters:
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the identity

    • inverse

      public static Quaternion inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
      Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the conjugate divided by the magnitude squared.

      a-1 := a* / |a|2

      If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the inverse
      See Also:
      magSq(Quaternion)

    • inverse

      public static Quaternion inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target, Quaternion conjugate)
      Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the its conjugate divided by its magnitude squared.

      a-1 := a* / |a|2

      If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      target - the output quaternion
      conjugate - the conjugate
      Returns:
      the inverse
      See Also:
      conj(Quaternion, Quaternion), dot(Quaternion, Quaternion), div(Quaternion, float, Quaternion)

    • invMulVector

      public static Vec3 invMulVector​(Quaternion q, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a vector by a quaternion's inverse, allowing a prior rotation to be undone.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      source - the source vector
      target - the target vector
      Returns:
      the unrotated vector

    • mag

      public static float mag​(Quaternion q)
      Finds the length, or magnitude, of a quaternion.

      |a| := √ a · a

      |a| := √ a a*
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      Returns:
      the magnitude
      See Also:
      Utils.sqrtUnchecked(float), dot(Quaternion, Quaternion)

    • magSq

      public static float magSq​(Quaternion q)
      Finds the magnitude squared of a quaternion. Equivalent to the dot product of a quaternion with itself and to the product of a quaternion with its conjugate.

      |a|2 := a · a

      |a|2 := a a*
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      Returns:
      the magnitude squared
      See Also:
      dot(Quaternion, Quaternion)

    • mix

      public static Quaternion mix​(Quaternion origin, Quaternion dest, float step, Quaternion target)
      Mixes two vectors together by a step in [0.0, 1.0]. Uses the easing function that is a static field belonging to the Quaternion class.
      Parameters:
      origin - the original quaternion
      dest - the destination quaternion
      step - the step
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the mix
      See Also:
      EASING

    • mul

      Multiplies a scalar and quaternion.
      Parameters:

      b - the quaternion
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the scaled quaternion

    • mul

      public static Quaternion mul​(Quaternion a, float b, Quaternion target)
      Multiplies a quaternion and scalar.
      Parameters:
      a - the quaternion
      b - the scalar
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the scaled quaternion

    • mul

      public static Quaternion mul​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b, Quaternion target)
      Multiplies two quaternions. Also referred to as the Hamilton product. Uses the formula

      a b := { areal breal - aimag · bimag , aimag × bimag + areal bimag + breal aimag }

      Quaternion multiplication is not commutative.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the product

    • mulVector

      public static Vec3 mulVector​(Quaternion q, Vec3 source, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a vector by a quaternion, in effect rotating the vector by the quaternion. Equivalent to promoting the vector to a pure quaternion, multiplying the rotation quaternion and promoted vector, then dividing the product by the rotation.

      a b := ( a { 0.0, b } ) / a

      The result is then demoted to a vector, as the real component should be 0.0 . This is often denoted as P' = RPR'.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      source - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the rotated vector

    • none

      public static boolean none​(Quaternion q)
      Tests if all components of the quaternion are zero.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      Vec3.none(Vec3)

    • normalize

      public static Quaternion normalize​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
      Divides a quaternion by its magnitude, such that its new magnitude is one and it lies on a 4D hyper-sphere. Uses the formula:

      â = a / |a| Quaternions with zero magnitude will return the identity.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the normalized quaternion
      See Also:
      div(Quaternion, float, Quaternion), mag(Quaternion)

    • random

      public static Quaternion random​(java.util.Random rng, Quaternion target)
      Creates a random unit quaternion. Uses an algorithm by Ken Shoemake, reproduced at this Math Stack Exchange discussion: Uniform Random Quaternion In a restricted angle range .
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the random quaternion

    • rotate

      public static Quaternion rotate​(Quaternion q, float radians, Vec3 axis, Quaternion target)
      Rotates a quaternion around an arbitrary axis by an angle.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      radians - the angle in radians
      axis - the axis
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the rotated quaternion
      See Also:
      magSq(Quaternion), Utils.invSqrtUnchecked(float), Utils.acos(float), Utils.modRadians(float), fromAxisAngle(float, Vec3, Quaternion)

    • rotateX

      public static Quaternion rotateX​(Quaternion q, float cosah, float sinah, Quaternion target)
      Rotates a vector around the x axis. Accepts pre-calculated sine and cosine of half the angle so that collections of quaternions can be efficiently rotated without repeatedly calling cos and sin.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      cosah - cosine of half the angle
      sinah - sine of half the angle
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the rotated quaternion

    • rotateX

      public static Quaternion rotateX​(Quaternion q, float radians, Quaternion target)
      Rotates a quaternion about the x axis by an angle. Do not use sequences of orthonormal rotations by Euler angles; this will result in gimbal lock, defeating the purpose behind a quaternion.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      radians - the angle in radians
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the rotated quaternion

    • rotateY

      public static Quaternion rotateY​(Quaternion q, float cosah, float sinah, Quaternion target)
      Rotates a vector around the y axis. Accepts pre-calculated sine and cosine of half the angle so that collections of quaternions can be efficiently rotated without repeatedly calling cos and sin.
      Parameters:
      q - the input quaternion
      cosah - cosine of half the angle
      sinah - sine of half the angle
      target - the output quaternion
      Returns:
      the rotated quaternion

    • rotateY

      public static Quaternion rotateY​(Quaternion q, float radians, Quaternion target)

      Parameters:

      radians - the angle in radians

      the rotated quaternion

      public static Quaternion rotateZ​(Quaternion q, float cosah, float sinah, Quaternion target)

      sinah - sine of half the angle

      the rotated quaternion

    • subNorm

      public static Quaternion subNorm​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b, Quaternion target, Quaternion diff)

      b - the right operand
      target - the output quaternion
      diff - the difference

    • toAxes

      public static void toAxes​(Quaternion q, Vec3 right, Vec3 forward, Vec3 up)
      Converts a quaternion to three axes, which in turn may constitute a rotation matrix. Use this instead of getRight(Quaternion, Vec3) , getForward(Quaternion, Vec3) and getUp(Quaternion, Vec3) if all three axes are needed.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      up - the up axis
      See Also:
      getForward(Quaternion, Vec3), getRight(Quaternion, Vec3), getUp(Quaternion, Vec3)

    • toAxisAngle

      public static float toAxisAngle​(Quaternion q, Vec3 axis)
      Converts a quaternion to an axis and angle. The angle is returned from the function. The axis is assigned to an output vector.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      axis - the output axis
      Returns:
      the angle
      See Also:
      magSq(Quaternion), Vec3.forward(Vec3), Math.abs(float), Math.sqrt(double), Math.acos(double)
